intro: Ceterach barbatum, commonly known as the hairy sea sparrow, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Ceterach barbatum is adapted to withstand salt spray and high wind exposure, making it a hardy coastal species.
